segment.source: Manage Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Manage Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: How to manage your Surface Hub after finishing the first-run program.
segment.target: How to manage your Surface Hub after finishing the first-run program.

segment.source: Manage Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Manage Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: How to manage your Surface Hub after finishing the first-run program.
segment.target: How to manage your Surface Hub after finishing the first-run program.

segment.source: Introduction
segment.target: Introduction

segment.source: After initial setup of Microsoft Surface Hub, the device’s settings and configuration can be modified or changed in several ways:
segment.target: After initial setup of Microsoft Surface Hub, the device’s settings and configuration can be modified or changed in several ways:

segment.source: Local management: using the Settings app on the device
segment.target: Local management: using the Settings app on the device

segment.source: Remote management: using a mobile device management (MDM) solution, like Microsoft Intune, AirWatch, or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Remote management: using a mobile device management (MDM) solution, like Microsoft Intune, AirWatch, or System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For locally-managed devices, administrator credentials are required to use the Settings app.
segment.target: For locally-managed devices, administrator credentials are required to use the Settings app.

segment.source: These can be login credentials for Active Directory, Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), or a local admin account.
segment.target: These can be login credentials for Active Directory, Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), or a local admin account.

segment.source: One of these will have been selected during first run (see Set up admins for this device).
segment.target: One of these will have been selected during first run (see Set up admins for this device).

segment.source: For remotely-managed devices, the device must be enrolled into an MDM solution, either during first run or in the Settings app.
segment.target: For remotely-managed devices, the device must be enrolled into an MDM solution, either during first run or in the Settings app.

segment.source: Be aware that the two management methods are not mutually exclusive—every device will have the capability to be locally managed, and devices can be remotely managed if you choose.
segment.target: Be aware that the two management methods are not mutually exclusive—every device will have the capability to be locally managed, and devices can be remotely managed if you choose.

segment.source: Note If a device is remotely managed, then any changes to local settings that are also remotely managed will only persist until the next time your Surface Hub syncs with your MDM solution.
segment.target: Note If a device is remotely managed, then any changes to local settings that are also remotely managed will only persist until the next time your Surface Hub syncs with your MDM solution.

segment.source: Once a sync occurs, the settings and policies defined on your MDM solution will be pushed to the device, overwriting the local changes.
segment.target: Once a sync occurs, the settings and policies defined on your MDM solution will be pushed to the device, overwriting the local changes.

segment.source: Surface Hub-only settings
segment.target: Surface Hub-only settings

segment.source: Surface Hubs have many settings that are common to other Windows devices, but also have settings which are only configurable on Surface Hubs.
segment.target: Surface Hubs have many settings that are common to other Windows devices, but also have settings which are only configurable on Surface Hubs.

segment.target: Configure Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server

segment.target: Change whether the device receives updates from the WSUS you choose.

segment.source: Which should I choose?
segment.target: Which should I choose?

segment.source: If you plan to deploy multiple Surface Hubs, we recommend that you manage your devices remotely.
segment.target: If you plan to deploy multiple Surface Hubs, we recommend that you manage your devices remotely.

segment.source: This requires that your organization use an MDM solution to deploy policies.
segment.target: This requires that your organization use an MDM solution to deploy policies.

segment.source: Every Surface Hub can be managed locally by an admin who physically logs in to the device.
segment.target: Every Surface Hub can be managed locally by an admin who physically logs in to the device.

segment.source: Which method is used to log in is decided during first run (see Set up admins for this device).
segment.target: Which method is used to log in is decided during first run (see Set up admins for this device).

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Accessibility
segment.target: Accessibility

segment.source: Accessibility settings for the Surface Hub can be changed by using the Settings app.
segment.target: Accessibility settings for the Surface Hub can be changed by using the Settings app.

segment.source: You'll find them under Ease of Access.
segment.target: You'll find them under Ease of Access.

segment.source: Your Surface Hub has the same accessibility options as Windows 10.
segment.target: Your Surface Hub has the same accessibility options as Windows 10.

segment.source: Change the Surface Hub device account
segment.target: Change the Surface Hub device account

segment.source: You can change the device account in Settings to either add an account if one was not already provisioned, or to change any properties of an account that was already provisioned.
segment.target: You can change the device account in Settings to either add an account if one was not already provisioned, or to change any properties of an account that was already provisioned.

segment.source: Device reset
segment.target: Device reset

segment.source: You may wish to reset your Surface Hub.
segment.target: You may wish to reset your Surface Hub.

segment.source: Install apps on your Surface Hub
segment.target: Install apps on your Surface Hub

segment.source: Admins can install apps can from either the Windows Store or the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: Admins can install apps can from either the Windows Store or the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: Manage settings with a local admin account
segment.target: Manage settings with a local admin account

segment.source: A local admin account will be set up on every Surface Hub as part of the first run program.
segment.target: A local admin account will be set up on every Surface Hub as part of the first run program.

segment.source: The only way to change the local admin options that you chose at that time is to reset the device.
segment.target: The only way to change the local admin options that you chose at that time is to reset the device.

segment.source: Manage settings with an MDM provider
segment.target: Manage settings with an MDM provider

segment.source: Surface Hub provides an enterprise management solution to help IT administrators manage policies and business applications on these devices using a mobile device management (MDM) solution.
segment.target: Surface Hub provides an enterprise management solution to help IT administrators manage policies and business applications on these devices using a mobile device management (MDM) solution.

segment.source: Monitor your Surface Hub
segment.target: Monitor your Surface Hub

segment.source: Monitoring for Surface Hub devices is enabled through Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).
segment.target: Monitoring for Surface Hub devices is enabled through Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).

segment.source: Save your BitLocker key
segment.target: Save your BitLocker key

segment.source: Every Surface Hub is automatically set up with BitLocker drive encryption software.
segment.target: Every Surface Hub is automatically set up with BitLocker drive encryption software.

segment.source: Microsoft strongly recommends that you make sure you back up your BitLocker recovery keys.
segment.target: Microsoft strongly recommends that you make sure you back up your BitLocker recovery keys.

segment.source: Using a room control system
segment.target: Using a room control system

segment.source: Room control systems can be used with your Surface Hub.
segment.target: Room control systems can be used with your Surface Hub.

segment.source: Windows updates
segment.target: Windows updates

segment.source: You can manage Windows updates on your Surface Hub by setting the maintenance window, deferring updates, or using WSUS.
segment.target: You can manage Windows updates on your Surface Hub by setting the maintenance window, deferring updates, or using WSUS.

segment.source: Wireless network management
segment.target: Wireless network management

segment.source: Surface Hub offers two options for network connectivity to your corporate network and Internet: wireless, and wired.
segment.target: Surface Hub offers two options for network connectivity to your corporate network and Internet: wireless, and wired.

segment.source: While both provide network access, we recommend you use a wired connection.
segment.target: While both provide network access, we recommend you use a wired connection.
